Description: Lower body sherd with handle root of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior glazed black; added red band lined in white above band of lotus buds in white outline with red centres; exterior: painted decoration consisting of possible goat (hoof remaining) to right; below, in handle zone, double guilloche pattern and handle frill between dilute lines; below, band and undetermined motif.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The exterior and interior surfaces of the sherd were burnt during the bombings in London in 1941. Goats are very rarely featured on Mature Animal Style chalices.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1586) (phase 2)
